instructions: In an app on your Mac, open a document, then choose Edit > Substitutions > Data Detectors (a checkmark shows it s on). Move the pointer over a phone number, email address, street address, date, or time anywhere in the text. Click the arrow in the box that outlines the data, then choose a command from the pop-up menu. You can also force click the outlined information.

Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cache Step 8 1 Open Google Chrome Image titled Android7chrome.png . Tap the Chrome app icon, which resembles a red, yellow, green, and blue sphere icon. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cache Step 9 2 Tap . It's in the top-right corner of the screen. A drop-down menu will appear. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cache Step 10 3 Tap . This option is in the drop-down menu. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cache Step 11 4 Tap . It's in the lower-left corner of the screen. On Android, this option is near the top of the screen. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cache Step 12 5 Tap to check it. You should see a blue checkmark appear next to it. If there's already a blue checkmark next to this option, skip this step. You can uncheck every other box on this page if you're only trying to clear the cache. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cache Step 13 6 Tap . It's at the bottom of the screen. On Android, tap CLEAR DATA here. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cache Step 14 7 Tap when prompted. Doing so will clear the cache for Chrome. On Android, tap CLEAR when prompted. Advertisement

Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cache Step 24 1 Open Firefox. Tap the Firefox app icon, which resembles an orange fox wrapped around a blue globe. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cache Step 25 2 Tap . It's in the bottom-right corner of the screen. A menu will appear. On Android, tap in the top-right corner of the screen. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cache Step 26 3 Tap . You'll find this in the menu. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cache Step 27 4 Scroll down and tap . It's in the "PRIVACY" section of options. On Android, the Clear private data option is in the middle of the page. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cache Step 28 5 Tap the white "Cache" switch. This switch is in the middle of the page. Tapping it will cause it to change color, indicating that the cached files will be cleared. If this switch is already blue, skip this step. On Android, you'll check the "Cache" checkbox instead. If you want to clear only the cache, tap any other blue switches (or checked boxes) on this page to turn them off. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cache Step 29 6 Tap . It's at the bottom of the screen. On Android, tap Clear data instead. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cache Step 30 7 Tap when prompted. Doing so will clear the cached files from your Firefox browser. Skip this step on Android. Advertisement

Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cache Step 52 1 Open your iPhone's Settings Image titled Iphonesettingsappicon.png . Tap the grey app with gears on it. This opens your iPhone's Settings page. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cache Step 53 2 Scroll down and tap . It's about a third of the way down the Settings page. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cache Step 54 3 Scroll down and tap . You'll find this near the bottom of the Safari page. Image titled Clear Your Browser's Cache Step 55 4 Tap when prompted. Doing so will clear all of your iPhone's Safari data, including the cached files and pages. Advertisement
